content.question: The graph above depicts the marginal social cost <math alttext="open parenthesis, M S C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MSC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, marginal private cost <math alttext="open parenthesis, M P C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and marginal social benefit <math alttext="open parenthesis, M S B, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MSB</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> associated with the production of a good that generates an externality. Based on the information in the graph, which of the following is true?

choices.label: There is a positive externality because, relative to the socially optimal output, too little is produced in an unregulated market.

The unregulated market produces <math alttext="Q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and sets price at <math alttext="P sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The allocatively efficient level of output is <math alttext="Q sub P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The good generates an external benefit equal to <math alttext="A B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AB</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
There is a negative externality because marginal social cost exceeds marginal private cost.

content.answer: There is a negative externality because marginal social cost exceeds marginal private cost.
